review_title: Working at Sinai Health Toronto as a postdoc is a truly enriching experience.
pros: As a postdoctoral fellow, I had the opportunity to work alongside world-renowned researchers in a collaborative and supportive environment. One of the most impressive aspects of Sinai Health Toronto is the emphasis placed on interdisciplinary collaboration. With researchers from a wide range of backgrounds, including medicine, biology, psychology, and engineering, the opportunities for cross-disciplinary collaboration are endless. This not only enhances the quality of research conducted, but also fosters an environment of innovation and creativity. The facilities at Sinai Health Toronto are state-of-the-art and offer a range of resources to support postdocs in their research pursuits. From cutting-edge equipment to access to large data sets, there are ample resources available to support a variety of research projects.
cons: Nothing bothers me to share

pros: Good culture and interesting topics.
cons: Can be long hours but that is to be expected with research.

review_title: Great place to work if you want a supportive environment
pros:
-Roles like this within a health care institution offer you the ability to have a positive impact on the community.
-Supportive environment, where employees are empowered to own their projects. 
-Lots of focus on the wellbeing of staff, including support resources.
-Fair compensation.
-Pension plan is a great option for long-term employees.
-They've recognized the need for, and invested in new facility (and tool) upgrades.
-Feel safe at the workplace
cons:
-Being such a large-size organization means it can lack the speed to turn around and implement new initiatives.
-Not as technologically advanced right now in terms of their systems or facilities. (not lagging, but not cutting-edge)

job_title: Mental Health Worker/Ward Clerk in Toronto, ON
pros:
Great team environment. There isn't anyone I don't like working with, including the nursing staff. 
The company provides information regarding current COVID cases, accurate information, and supports available.
The position is Unuionized with CUPE
You can get shifts on other units once you've trained there
Company-wide, and unit-specific activities and ways to connect socially. Very important especially during lockdown/pandemic times.
Unit and company is cognizant of the mental health pressures experienced by its staff during lockdown/pandemic and endeavours to help mitigate stress, and provide supports.
cons:
Part-time workers are not eligible for benefits coverage
Working every weekend and every STAT holiday can be wearing on you sometimes

job_title: Personal Support Worker in Toronto, ON
pros:
Work in one area
Working staff is great and honest
cons:
For people who drive nothing you would be paying for it all! (Gass, parking, etc). You won't be able to write anything off at all no T200 l!  But after the probation you would only get 65% of the TTC metro pass.  That won't cover much! 
Your given work and it could be all together but from what I seen its spread out over a long day!   
They ask you to use your own phone to call in to a system to get work and check it over the day.  (This year they are giving staff a work phone and it will come with lots of rules) 
You have to keep your CPR but not at a health level so if you have other jobs you would have to take it your own.  (This is fine however if you do it in the office. They pay for the class and your time, on your own you would have to pay it and your not payed time but they would let you have the time to do it).
They in a union so your paying the government and the union dues on each check.   So why do this job?

pros: Great team work on every unit
cons: Parking isn’t the best but not the worst

pros: Steady work with known schedule.  Union position (CUPE 79). Good benefits.  The actual workers are good people who have families and are just trying to get by in life.
cons:
The period of time that I worked at this facility the department that I worked in was in constatnt turmoil.  They tried to bring in an outside contract management firm for our department. (Crothall).
In the last 18 months that I worked there, we went through 12 different supervisors and 4 different department leaders.  I had finally had enough of the stress of constantly having new rules from different people that totally contradicted the collective agreement that I resigned.  I had worked there for 9+ years. The last year that I actually worked there was 2009, but the drop down menu only goes back to 2012.

pros: Close to the subway, lots of food choices around the area
cons:
Management does not provide training, first day of the job, they literally just emailed all the instructions to me and expect me to know everything right away. 

Very disorganized. There are days when management is oblivious how busy the Department is. 

Very high turnover rate, management hired about 10 temps in this year and last year. The original full time permanent people quit because of the burnout. Again, I will emphasize - there is NO PROPER TRAINING provided!!!

pros: great opportunity to work on public awareness and fundraising campaigns. Good benefits and excellent pension plan. Not much room for growth or raises.
cons: You can easily get sheltered siloed into one area and they are not interested if you are not current with technology and new media in the private sector. Once I left I was shocked to find out how behind I was with new media and what was expected of me regarding web and digital design at other companies.
